nodes.bodyText: The intention was to remove only scope annotations, but now I see that I pulled the trigger a little to quickly on it :)
Actually, you should also remove stereotypes. And additional bean defining annotations may declare a default scope too...
So should we just go with removeAll? I wanted to avoid that if possible.

I don't think just stereotypes will do.
If you don't want a class picked up as a bean, you'd need to remove any bean defining annotation from it. That can be scope, qualifier, stereotype, interceptor binding. See spec. Note that in Quarkus we can also have additional bean defining annotation.
So it seems that removing all the annotations is innevitable with this approach, right?

Probably... but at that point it might be easier to instead just temper with Alternative and priority.
BTW how many build time profiles are there? This approach will make a bean exclusively available in one of them, what if you want the bean to be available in two or more profiles but not in third?

For now I just pushed removeAll. I'll give the Alternatives approach a go later on.
Very good question about the profiles! There is always a single active build profile (but a user could decide to use name he/she likes, although by default there are three, dev, test, prod), so maybe we should also introduce the WhenNotBuildTimeProfile. How does that sound?
@geoand sounds good. Or you could make WhenBuildTimeProfile a repeating annotation.

What is the usual CDI strategy in "similar" cases?
Best try and be consistent if possible.

I don't see similarities that we could stick to here, might just be lack of caffeine though :)
Maybe @mkouba has some ideas?

Recently we added the ability to enable alternatives via config file and those also use Integer.MAX_VALUE.
So if a user has an alternative bean that is enabled that way and then adds another bean just for one given profile, he will actually end up with two alternatives with maximum priority (which I think should blow up). Not sure if this corner case is something we want to address right away, just writing it down :)
Hm, yes that would blow up with ambiguous dependency. But I'd say that it's more like a corner case and maybe we could add a note to the docs? Or even use Intereg.MAX_VALUE - 1 ;-).

How about goign with Intereg.MAX_VALUE - 1 for now and revisiting if this every becomes a problem?
Seems like an extreme corner case to me.
+1 to Intereg.MAX_VALUE - 1, it just occurred to me so I thought I'd mention it :)
Accidental double grave accent(`) around WhenNotBuildTimeProfile?
